page.title: 17NASSINGTON CHURCH.
page.content: The church is a Church of England church named St Mary the Virgin and All Saints.It was first built in 1193. Two or three services are held on Sundays.Special services are held on Mothers Day and at special times like Christmas and Easter.There have been 12 funerals and 3 weddings in the last year and 3070 people have been to church.It costs slx thousand pounds to look after each year.There are many gravestones but the graveyard is not used any more.People are buried at the cemetary between Yarwell and Nassington There are other religions in Nassington Roman Catholics go to church in Peterborough,Stamford and Oundle.Meth- dists go to Yarwell chapel.The chapel here closed in 1980.It is used as an office and the village hall. Sunday school has 40 members aged from 3 to 13 years.
